question: Will Sam Altman's net worth exceed $1.3 billion on the Forbes Real-Time Billionaires List on March 31, 2025?
description: As of December 25, 2025, Altman's net worth was listed as $1.1 billion, according to Forbes.
fine_print: If the resolution source is unavailable on March 31, 2025, resolution will wait until it is available (at which point it resolves based on the data shown), until April 7, 2025, at which point this question will be **annulled**. For more details on various edge cases regarding availability of or changes to the resolution source, please see Metaculus's ambiguity and annulment policies [here](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#ambiguous-annulled).
news:
Here are the relevant news articles:

**Elon Musk's Net Worth Takes a Hit as Tesla Shares Plummet**
Elon Musk, the world's richest person, received a significant blow on Tuesday as the value of his Tesla shares plummeted, resulting in a net worth loss of $15.9 billion, or approximately ₹13,74,13,60,35,000. According to the Bloomberg Billionaires Index, his net worth now stands at $379 billion. This year, his net worth has declined by $53.7 billion. Musk had offered to buy OpenAI, the parent company of ChatGPT, for $97.4 billion, but CEO Sam Altman rejected the offer. Altman stated that if Musk is interested, he is willing to sell Twitter. Meanwhile, six of the world's top 10 richest people saw their net worth decline on Tuesday, including Jeff Bezos, Larry Ellison, Larry Page, Sergey Brin, and Steve Ballmer. Mark Zuckerberg, Bernard Arnault, Bill Gates, and Warren Buffett saw their net worth increase. The top 10 richest people in the world are: Mark Zuckerberg ($253 billion), Jeff Bezos ($252 billion), Larry Ellison ($199 billion), Bernard Arnault ($189 billion), Larry Page ($166 billion), Bill Gates ($166 billion), Sergey Brin ($156 billion), Warren Buffett ($148 billion), and Steve Ballmer ($144 billion).
Original language: hi
Publish date: February 12, 2025 05:04 AM
Source:[Navbharat Times](https://navbharattimes.indiatimes.com/business/business-news/elon-musk-lost-16-billion-dollar-with-tesla-shares-down-more-than-6-percent/articleshow/118162675.cms)

**Sam Altman's Net Worth: How the OpenAI CEO Built His Fortune**
Sam Altman, CEO of OpenAI, has built his fortune by investing in startups and technology, not through OpenAI stock. According to Época NEGÓCIOS, Altman's net worth is estimated at $2 billion (R$ 11.5 billion). Altman, a prominent figure in the tech industry, has turned down Elon Musk's offer to buy OpenAI, the company behind ChatGPT. His wealth comes from strategic investments in startups, venture capital funds, and stakes in major tech companies.

Publish date: February 11, 2025 04:21 PM
Source:[Época NEGÓCIOS](https://epocanegocios.globo.com/tecnologia/noticia/2025/02/qual-e-a-fortuna-de-sam-altman.ghtml)

**Musk-Altman Feud Escalates: A $100 Billion Offer and a Twitter Jibe**
A new controversy has emerged in the ongoing feud between Elon Musk and Sam Altman, the two billionaires in the world of general artificial intelligence. Musk offered to buy OpenAI's controlling non-profit unit for nearly $100 billion, but Altman mocked the offer. He posted on X, 'No thanks, but if you want to, we can buy Twitter for $9.74 billion.' Interestingly, Altman made this post on the same platform that Musk bought in 2022 for $44 billion.
Original language: hi
Publish date: February 11, 2025 03:55 PM
Source:[hindi.moneycontrol.com](https://hindi.moneycontrol.com/news/world/how-fight-between-elon-musk-and-sam-altman-openai-turned-into-a-long-legal-battle-understand-the-whole-matter-1956902.html)

**Sam Altman-Elon Musk Feud Timeline: Altman Says Musk Isn't A 'Happy Person' After 'Crazy' OpenAI Offer**
The feud between Sam Altman and Elon Musk escalated as Musk made a nearly $100 billion offer to buy the non-profit entity controlling Altman's OpenAI. However, the dispute quickly turned into name-calling, with Musk's offer being seen as 'crazy' by Altman, who described Musk as 'not a happy person'. The two billionaires are at the center of the AI arms race, with OpenAI and xAI competing against other companies like Google, Meta, and Anthropic. OpenAI has received significant investments from Microsoft and Nvidia, valuing the company at $157 billion. Meanwhile, Musk's net worth is estimated at $392 billion, with less than $50 billion coming from his stake in xAI. Altman's net worth is $1.2 billion, mostly due to early investments in companies like Reddit and Stripe.

Publish date: February 11, 2025 02:00 PM

**Elon Musk's Net Worth Falls Below $400 Billion. Is Donald Trump To Blame? - News18**
Elon Musk's net worth has fallen below $400 billion for the first time in two months due to a 27% slide in Tesla's share price. The decline is attributed to dismal monthly sales, with deliveries in Germany plummeting 59% and China sales falling 11.5% from last year. Musk's focus on Washington and his involvement in DOGE, a cost-cutting initiative, may be impacting Tesla's performance. Additionally, his bid to buy OpenAI for $95 billion was rejected by CEO Sam Altman. The decline in Musk's wealth comes after it peaked at $486.4 billion following Donald Trump's election, according to the Bloomberg Billionaires Index.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 11, 2025 09:04 AM
Source:[News18](https://www.news18.com/world/elon-musks-net-worth-falls-below-400-billion-is-donald-trump-to-blame-9223219.html)

**Who is this man with PM Modi, French President Macron? Is world's youngest self-made billionaire, shaping future of AI, his net worth is...**
Alexandr Wang, the 25-year-old CEO of Scale AI, recently met with Prime Minister Narendra Modi and French President Emmanuel Macron in France. Wang, one of the world's youngest self-made billionaires, co-founded Scale AI, a company that helps businesses process raw data for artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning. Scale AI has been valued at $7.3 billion and serves around 300 clients, including General Motors and Flexport. Wang's estimated net worth stands at $2 billion, according to Forbes. However, the company has faced controversy over its labor practices, with allegations of exploiting contract workers. Wang frequently advises US lawmakers on AI policies and national security, positioning him alongside industry leaders like OpenAI CEO Sam Altman.

**Musk v Altman: Watch the billionaires' faux fight for humanity**
The feud between Elon Musk and OpenAI's Sam Altman has escalated, with Musk reportedly offering $US97.4 billion to take control of OpenAI. Altman rejected the offer on X, saying 'no thank you but we will buy Twitter for $(US)9.74 billion if you want.' This jab at Musk is significant, given he paid more than four times that amount for Twitter three years ago. The exchange is reminiscent of a high-stakes wrestling match, with both billionaires engaging in a battle of wits and financial muscle.

**Elon Musk's Net Worth Falls Below $400 Billion as Tesla (TSLA) S**
Elon Musk's net worth has fallen below $400 billion for the first time in two months, due to a 27% drop in Tesla's stock price. According to the Bloomberg Billionaires Index, Tesla's stock and options comprise over 60% of Musk's wealth, which peaked at $486.4 billion in December. Analysts Ben Kallo and Davis Sunderland from Robert W. Baird noted a dampened enthusiasm for Tesla's autonomous taxi business. Musk's 42% stake in SpaceX is valued at $136 billion, and he led a consortium offering nearly $95 billion to acquire OpenAI, which was declined by OpenAI's CEO Sam Altman.

Publish date: February 11, 2025 12:52 AM

**Sam Altman-Elon Musk Feud Timeline: Musk Reportedly Bids $94.7 Billion For Altman's OpenAI**
Billionaire Elon Musk has reportedly made a nearly $100 billion offer to buy the non-profit entity controlling OpenAI, a move that adds a new wrinkle to the public feud between Musk and OpenAI's CEO Sam Altman. According to The Wall Street Journal, Musk's offer is a significant escalation in the AI arms race between OpenAI and xAI, with other competitors including Google, Meta, and Anthropic. OpenAI, which is backed by Microsoft and valued at $157 billion, has a joint venture with Oracle and foreign investment groups to build AI infrastructure in the U.S. Musk's net worth is estimated at $392 billion, while Altman's net worth is estimated at $1.2 billion. Altman does not have equity in OpenAI, but has been discussed for a potential 7% equity stake worth $11 billion.

**The Billionaires' Quest for Immortality: Investing in the Longevity Industry**
The longevity industry is expected to be worth 578 billion euros this year, driven by the super-rich. According to UBS, those with over 48 million euros in assets are willing to spend half of their wealth on living 10 years longer. Billionaires such as Bryan Johnson, Jeff Bezos, and Peter Thiel are investing heavily in companies that aim to reverse or stop aging. Johnson, for example, takes over 50 pills a day and has a team of 30 experts monitoring his health. Bezos has invested 2.9 billion euros in Altos Labs, which aims to reprogram human cells and potentially reverse aging. Sam Altman, CEO of OpenAI, is investing in Retro Biosciences, which aims to increase human lifespan by 10 years. Longevity Investors, a company founded by Marc P. Bernegger, is vouching for these investments, saying that '90 to 120 years of life is scientifically possible'.

**Sam Altman's Net Worth: The Billion Dollar Journey of the ChatGPT Maker**
Sam Altman's net worth stands at $1.2 billion, according to Forbes, primarily due to his investments in companies like Stripe, Reddit, Airbnb, and Helion Energy. He does not directly own equity in OpenAI, the maker of ChatGPT, as it is a privately held non-profit company. Altman's entrepreneurial journey includes founding Loopt, a social mapping company, and serving as the President of Y Combinator. He took the helm of OpenAI in 2019 and led the launch of ChatGPT in 2022, which has since been valued at over $340 billion. Altman has been instrumental in OpenAI's growth, and once it converts to a for-profit structure, he is expected to rise to an enviable position on the world's billionaire list. Altman also owns pricey real estate in California, San Francisco, and Hawaii.

**OpenAI CEO Sam Altman Has a Billion-Dollar Net Worth. Here's How He Got There**
OpenAI CEO Sam Altman has an estimated net worth of $1.2 billion, according to Forbes. However, he does not own direct equity in OpenAI. Instead, he has an indirect interest in the company through a small investment made by a fund in startup accelerator Y Combinator. Altman's wealth primarily comes from his 8.7% stake in Reddit, which had a market capitalization of $35.9 billion as of late January. OpenAI, where Altman serves as CEO, is valued at an estimated $157 billion and is projected to bring in $2.7 billion in revenue from ChatGPT in 2024.

The feud between AI billionaires Sam Altman and Elon Musk has escalated after President Donald Trump announced a $500 billion Stargate initiative, which bolsters Altman's OpenAI and gives the company a significant advantage in the AI arms race against Musk's xAI. According to Forbes, Musk's net worth is estimated at $425 billion, with less than $50 billion coming from his stake in xAI. As OpenAI's CEO, Altman does not have equity in the company, but Bloomberg reports that OpenAI has discussed granting him a 7% equity stake, which would be worth $11 billion at the company's current valuation of $157 billion.

**Billionaires Attend Trump's Inauguration Ceremony, Total Net Worth Reaches $1.35 Trillion**
The total net worth of the billionaires who attended President Donald Trump's inauguration ceremony is $1.35 trillion, according to Forbes. The list includes the world's richest person, Elon Musk, with a net worth of $433.9 billion, as well as Jeff Bezos, Mark Zuckerberg, and Sergey Brin. Musk, who spent over $250 million to support Trump's election campaign in November, also attended the ceremony. Other notable attendees included Sam Altman, CEO of OpenAI, with a net worth of $1.1 billion, and Tim Cook, CEO of Apple, with a net worth of $2.2 billion. Trump's own net worth is estimated to be $6.7 billion, coming from his investments in Truth Social, real estate, and cryptocurrencies. 'It's a great day for America,' Trump said, 'and I'm honored to have so many successful business leaders here to support me.'

**Trump's Inauguration Attended by World's Richest Individuals**
The inauguration of Donald Trump as President of the United States was attended by some of the world's wealthiest individuals, including four of the five richest men on the planet. The total net worth of the attendees was estimated to be $1.2 trillion. The list of attendees included Jeff Bezos, founder of Amazon, with a net worth of $239.4 billion; Mark Zuckerberg, founder of Meta, with a net worth of $211.8 billion; and Elon Musk, CEO of Tesla and the richest man in the world, with a net worth of $433.9 billion. Musk, a close friend of Trump, had donated over $250 million to his election campaign. Other notable attendees included Sam Altman, CEO of OpenAI, with a net worth of $1.1 billion; Tim Cook, CEO of Apple, with a net worth of $2.2 billion; and Rupert Murdoch, former CEO of Fox News, with a net worth of $22.2 billion. According to Forbes, the total amount raised by Trump's inauguration fund was over $170 million, more than three times the amount raised by President Joe Biden's inauguration fund four years ago.

The inauguration of President Donald Trump was attended by some of the world's richest individuals, with a combined net worth of over $1 trillion. **The Three Richest Men in the World Attend Trump's Inauguration**
For the first time in modern history, the Inauguration Day of Donald Trump will bring together the three richest men in the world, according to Forbes' real-time ranking: Elon Musk, Jeff Bezos, and Mark Zuckerberg. Their combined wealth is $884 billion, with Musk alone holding $433.9 billion. Musk, a major Trump supporter, has been appointed to lead a new 'Department of Government Efficiency' alongside Vivek Ramaswamy. Bezos and Zuckerberg separately met with Trump at his Mar-a-lago residence in 2024. Bezos had already begun to support Trump before the election, while Zuckerberg shifted to the right shortly after. Other billionaires attending the inauguration include Tim Cook ($2.2 billion), Sam Altman ($1.1 billion), Scott Bessent ($1.5 billion), Howard Lutnick ($1.5 billion), Doug Burgum ($1.5 billion), and Steve Witkoff ($1.5 billion).

**Billionaires Queue Up to Attend Trump's Inauguration**
Billionaires with high-profile names are lining up to attend Donald Trump's inauguration next week, according to Forbes. The three richest people in the world, Jeff Bezos ($235.3 billion), Mark Zuckerberg ($212.6 billion), and Elon Musk ($429.8 billion), are expected to attend the event. Musk, the CEO of Tesla and the world's richest person, has spent over $250 million to help Trump win the November elections. Sam Altman, the CEO of OpenAI ($1.1 billion), who has donated to the inauguration, is also planning to attend. Zuckerberg is one of the organizers of a reception in honor of Trump before the inauguration, along with other billionaire sponsors, including Miriam Adelson ($31.8 billion), Tilman Fertitta ($10.2 billion), and Todd Ricketts ($4 billion). **Sam Altman Accused of Sexual Abuse by His Sister**
Sam Altman, the 39-year-old founder of Open AI and Chat GPT, has been accused of sexual abuse by his sister Ann Altman. According to the court documents obtained by BBC, the alleged abuse occurred regularly from 1997 to 2006, when Ann was 3 years old and Sam was 12. Ann claims that her brother emotionally and physically abused her, including rape, which has caused her significant physical and emotional harm, including depression and anxiety. She is seeking damages of approximately 830,000 SEK. In a joint statement on X, Sam Altman and his family deny the allegations as 'completely false'. They claim that Ann has mental health issues and that they have been providing her with financial support, but she continues to demand more money, causing 'enormous pain' for the family. Sam Altman's net worth is estimated to be over 12.2 billion SEK, according to Forbes.

**ChatGPT founder accused of child sex abuse by sister  --  RT World News**
Sam Altman, the CEO of OpenAI and a key figure in artificial intelligence, has been accused of child sex abuse by his sister Annie. Annie filed a lawsuit in the US District Court in Missouri, claiming she suffered sexual abuse from the age of three, when Sam was 12 years old. The abuse allegedly included rape and caused Annie 'severe emotional distress, mental anguish, and depression.' Sam Altman has denied the allegations, suggesting that his sister is seeking financial gain. The Altman family released a joint statement, claiming that Annie is facing 'mental health challenges' and 'refuses conventional treatment.' They also stated that they have provided Annie with substantial financial support and offered to buy her a house through a trust, but she continues to demand more money. Sam Altman's estimated net worth is $1.1 billion, according to Forbes.
Original language: en
Publish date: January 08, 2025 03:14 PM
Source:[RT](https://www.rt.com/news/610583-chatgpt-founder-child-abuse/)

**Sam Altman: The Man Behind OpenAI's Rise to Prominence**
Sam Altman, the 39-year-old CEO of OpenAI, has a single goal: to develop artificial general intelligence (AGI) that can equal humans in all tasks. He co-founded Loopt, a location-based social network, at 19 and sold it for $43.4 million. He also co-founded Hydrazine Capital and became a partner at Y Combinator, investing in companies like Airbnb and Dropbox. Altman has faced criticism from colleagues for his approach to deploying AI, but he assures that he wants a safe and secure deployment. He predicts that AGI will increase human abilities to solve major problems and lead to massive prosperity. However, experts believe that his forecasts are too optimistic. Altman is also a billionaire, with a fortune estimated at $2 billion, and has invested in companies like Helion Energy, which specializes in nuclear fusion.
Original language: en
Publish date: December 28, 2024 11:39 AM
Source:[gearrice.com](https://www.gearrice.com/article/portrait-8-things-to-know-about-sam-altman-the-man-at-the-head-of-the-chatgpt-phenomenon-openai/)

forecasters.initial_reasoning: Historically, shifts in net worth for individuals on the Forbes Real-Time Billionaires List can be attributed to fluctuations in stock prices, business ventures, and market conditions. In analyzing similar cases of tech entrepreneurs with significant investments in volatile markets, the probability of a net worth surpassing a specific threshold within a few months typically falls around the 25% mark due to the inherent volatility and the time constraint.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Current Economic Climate
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: The tech sector is experiencing a boom with substantial investments in AI and tech companies, which are strongly influencing stock prices positively. This increases the potential for tech entrepreneurs' net worth to rise.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Sam Altman's Investment Portfolio
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: Sam Altman is heavily involved in AI-focused ventures, which are currently experiencing significant growth and investment, supporting the likelihood of a rise in his net worth.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Potential Market Corrections
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: Given the current high valuations, there is a risk of market corrections which could negatively impact the stock market and consequently Altman's net worth.

revised_reasoning.points_reinforcing_prior_analysis: Sam Altman's net worth is reported to be between $1.2 billion and $2 billion in multiple news articles, indicating he's already close to or exceeding the threshold. Significant investments and dealings in the AI sector, including ventures with Microsoft and potential stake in OpenAI, add potential for rapid financial growth.
revised_reasoning.points_challenging_prior_analysis: Altman does not hold a direct equity stake in OpenAI and his wealth is primarily attributed to investments in companies like Reddit and Stripe. The potential negative effects of the sexual abuse allegations against him could impact his reputation and financial dealings adversely.

forecasters.initial_reasoning: To establish an initial probability, we consider the base rate of individuals maintaining or increasing their wealth position from one year to the next. Forbes' historical data shows that billionaires, particularly those involved in technology and high-growth sectors, have a roughly 60% likelihood of increasing their net worth year-over-year. This factors in market corrections, economic cycles, and personal business achievements which may affect net worth standings.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Technology Sector Performance
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: Sam Altman, being heavily involved in the technology sector, is likely impacted by the performance of this sector. Historically, the technology sector has outperformed many other sectors, demonstrating resilience and growth even in uncertain economic times. This sector's performance typically supports asset appreciation for individuals involved in tech ventures.

perspective_derived_factors.name: US Economic Policy Impact
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: Current US economic policies, including interest rates and regulatory environment, can influence Altman's investments and overall financial growth. If the policies favor growth and investments in innovation (as has often been the case), it could positively impact his net worth.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Market Volatility
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: Economic uncertainties or high market volatility can negatively impact net worth. Given the unpredictability of the financial markets and potential macroeconomic challenges, there could be a moderating effect on wealth appreciation.

perspective_derived_factors.name: AI and Innovation Trends
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: Given Altman's focus on artificial intelligence and innovative companies, trends in AI adoption and investment are directly relevant. Positive trends in AI could significantly contribute to an increase in his net worth due to potential capital appreciation and innovation premiums.

revised_reasoning.points_reinforcing_prior_analysis: Several articles confirm Sam Altman's net worth at $1.2 billion, which is very close to the $1.3 billion threshold considered. OpenAI's significant valuation and potential future equity stake for Altman provide optimism for an increase in his net worth. Additionally, Altman's entrepreneurial track record in high-growth tech sectors like AI supports potential net worth growth.
revised_reasoning.points_challenging_prior_analysis: Altman's current lack of direct equity in OpenAI limits immediate net worth growth derived from the company's success. Allegations against Altman, while denied, represent potential reputational risk that could indirectly affect his wealth through potential disruptions in his investment activities or OpenAI's perception.

forecasters.initial_reasoning: Historically, the growth of technology companies can significantly impact the wealth of their leaders due to the industry's dynamic nature and high valuation potential. Considering previous trends in tech industries where rapid growth can lead to substantial increases in net worth, it's not uncommon for leaders of successful tech companies to experience significant growth in their personal fortunes. Sam Altman, being a prominent figure in the tech industry, has substantial investments and influence, which could affect his net worth positively. Historically, billionaires in the tech industry have seen their wealth increase by over 10% per annum in prosperous conditions.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Industry Growth
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: The technology sector continues to grow at a substantial rate, driven by innovations in AI, blockchain, and more. If Sam Altman's ventures are well-positioned within these technologies, the valuation of his investments could appreciate significantly.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Market Volatility
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: The tech sector is subject to significant market fluctuations. Any downward turn in the market or economic instability could negatively impact Sam Altman’s net worth. However, market conditions presently show no imminent signs of downturns impacting tech leaders negatively.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Individual Company Performance
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: If Altman's key investments or companies showcase strong performance metrics or release successful products, his net worth could see a substantial rise. Given Altman's track record of successful ventures, it is reasonable to expect a positive outlook.

revised_reasoning.points_challenging_prior_analysis: The allegations against Sam Altman might create reputational challenges affecting investments or public perception, which might indirectly impact his net worth. However, current valuations reported do not include speculative equity from OpenAI, thus limiting immediate changes without explicit investment success or changes.

forecasters.initial_reasoning: Sam Altman's net worth has been closely tied to the performance of OpenAI, other tech ventures, and his investments. Historically, tech entrepreneurs in similar positions see significant fluctuations based on market performance, company valuations, and investment outcomes. Given the volatility in the tech industry, a reasonable base rate for a significant change in net worth (over 10%) within a few months is around 40%, based on past observations of similar profiles in tech valuation changes within short periods.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Innovation Cycles
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: In professional cycling, just like in tech, innovation and performance improvements can significantly affect outcomes. If OpenAI or other ventures are entering new product cycles or showcasing breakthroughs, it would positively affect valuations and thus Altman's net worth.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Performance Optimization
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: Sam Altman's strategic focus on optimizing business performance and operational efficiency can reduce costs and increase company value. This is analogous to marginal gains strategies in cycling, where small efficiencies lead to significant performance improvements.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Market Volatility
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: Given the tech market's volatility, similar to the variable conditions in cycling races, unexpected downturns could negatively impact the ease with which companies can grow or maintain high valuations.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Competitive Landscape
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: Just as competition in cycling can impact performance results, intense competition in AI and tech could pressure valuations negatively if competitors make significant advances. If Altman's ventures face especially intense competition that potentially diminishes market share or innovation lead, this could lower net worth growth.
